comment: AWFUL. She was extremely distracted when I took her class.. she forgot the keys to the audio booths on the only class day we had to do a project(3 groups, 1 booth in the lab?!). As a class, we went to the Com. Dept. office to get keys. WHY COULDN'T SHE DO THAT!? Unclear grading, unclear expectations, seems disinterested in teaching. tests were ok.

Bradley gets a bad rap because her class is hard. Most of the students who don't like her don't pay attention in her class. You CANNOT just pick up production. She teaches you how to do it. You HAVE to listen. No one else seems to get that. She answers emails quickly and her tests are easy if you study the study guides.
So unprofessional and quite rude. She can't seem to back herself up or take any issue that comes up with her students. She's a horrible professor, she doesn't even deserve that title.

She argues with students in class and behaves unprofessionally. If you have a problem with her class, you're not allowed to take it up with her. You have to go speak with Dr. Wassmuth, head of the Communication Department.

Worst prof I have taken at KSU. She requires readings but never discusses them, blames all the racism and problems in the world on straight white men, wants you to take your issues with assignments to another professor, and you basically have to teach yourself. I thought I would really enjoy this class but Bradley has completely ruined that idea.

She is the worst professor I have ever had. She has no passion for teaching. She expects you to teach yourself and if any mistakes happen don't expect her to help you out. She blames the students for everything and nothing is ever her fault. She has the worst attitude I have ever seen in a professor and wouldn't recommend her to my worst enemy.

If you're white, male, or heterosexual, or heaven forbid all three, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. You are responsible for all the ills of society. You are the reason minorities are discriminated against. Required mandatory volunteer work - fine, if the class wasn't at 6:30 PM. Nontraditional students aren't known for having free time during the day.

When a professor tells you to take your problems with their assignments up with another professor, it's not okay. i'm not learning anything new in this class and am finding it to be pointless. The added stress of 4 or 5 papers is ridiculous when you're not learning anything from them or your professor.
